meanings.sent1: We need to prelocate the meeting room for tomorrow's presentation.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prelocate the new office building before the grand opening.
meanings.sent3: I prelocated my favorite spot in the park for our picnic, but someone else took it!
meanings.sent4: Her intuition seemed to prelocate the hidden treasure in the old map.
meanings.sent5: The detective's keen eye helped him prelocate the suspect in the crowded market.

meanings.definition: To assign a location before use
meanings.sent1: Before the event, we must prelocate the parking spots for the VIP guests.
meanings.sent2: The librarian will prelocate the new books on the shelves for easy access.
meanings.sent3: I prelocated the perfect spot for my plant in the garden, but it didn't get enough sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The architect's vision was to prelocate each room in the house for optimal flow.
meanings.sent5: The chef will prelocate the ingredients on the counter before starting to cook.
